instance.context:
Later , Shea owned and operated the Long_Island Indians , a minor_league professional football_team . He was the lawyer for Ted_Collins ' old Boston_Yankees in the National_Football_League . All was quiet in the office of the Yankees and the local National_Leaguers yesterday . On Friday , Roger_Maris , the Yankee outfielder and
winner of the American_League 's most-valuable-player award , will meet with Roy_Hamey , the general_manager . Maris is in_line for a big raise . Arnold_Palmer and Sam_Snead will be among those honored at the national awards dinner of the Metropolitan_Golf_Writers_Association tonight . The dinner will be held at the Hotel_Pierre .

Maris is in_line for a big raise . Arnold_Palmer and Sam_Snead will be among those honored at the national awards dinner of the Metropolitan_Golf_Writers_Association tonight . The dinner will be held at the Hotel_Pierre . Palmer , golf 's leading money
winner in 1960 , and Snead will be saluted as the winning team in the Canada_Cup matches last June in Dublin . Deane_Beman , the National_Amateur champion , and all the metropolitan district champions , including Bob_Gardner , the amateur title-holder , also will receive awards . The writers ' Gold_Tee_Award will go to John_McAuliffe of Plainfield , N._J. , and Palm_Beach , Fla. , for his sponsorship of charity tournaments . Horton_Smith of Detroit , a former president of the Professional_Golfers_Association , will receive the Ben_Hogan_Trophy for his comeback following a recent illness .

a vote to select the
winner of a position or political office ;

a final election to resolve an earlier election that did not produce a
winner ;

a contest with rules to determine a
winner ;

a game in which players hit a wooden ball through a series of hoops ; the
winner is the first to traverse all the hoops and hit a peg ;

a child's_game in which players march to music around a group of chairs that contains one chair less than the number of players ; when the music abruptly stops the players scramble to sit and the player who does not find a chair is eliminated ; then a chair is removed and the march resumes until only the
winner is seated ;

a card_game for two players one of whom is usually a child ; the deck is place face down with one card face upward ; players draw from the deck alternately hoping to build up or down from the open card ; the player with the fewest cards when the deck is exhausted is the
winner ;

a card_game based on collecting sets and sequences ; the
winner is the first to meld all their cards ;

betting where
winners share the total amount wagered ;

in a single round , the sequence of cards played by all the players ; the high card is the
winner ;

a large metal vessel with two handles that is awarded as a trophy to the
winner of a competition ;

an annual prize awarded by the French government in a competition of painters and artists and sculptors and musicians and architects ; the
winner in each category receives support for a period of study in Rome ;

the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the
winner is undecided ;

in_general , any very close finish ; in_particular , a finish of a race in which the contestants are so close together that the
winner must be determined from a photograph taken at the instant of finishing ;

an occasion on which a
winner is selected from among two or more contestants ;

a preliminary race in which the
winner advances to a more important race ;

a sporting competition in which contestants play a series of games to decide the
winner ;

the final match between the
winners of all previous matches in an elimination_tournament ;

one of the four competitions in an elimination_tournament whose
winners go_on to play in the semifinals ;

a
winner ( of a race or an election etc. ) whose victory is contested ;

the
winner of a lottery ;

only
winners need apply ;

the
winner at medal_play of a tournament ;
winner of a Nobel_prize ;

someone entrusted to hold the stakes for two or more persons betting against one another ; must deliver the stakes to the
winner ;

an unexpected
winner ; someone who defeats the favorite competitor ;

a
winner by a wide margin ;

a situation in which no one can emerge as a clear
winner ;

for the
winner to keep all ;

attempt to forecast the
winner and assign odds for or against a contestant ;

be the
winner in a contest or competition ; be victorious ;
